subjectCategories: LAW, POLITICAL SCIENCE AND SPACE POLICY
abstract: The United Nations (U.N.) is continuing its deliberations on the use of nuclear power sources (NPS) in space. Although no complete set of legal principles has yet been agreed upon, certain scientific and technical criteria for the safe design and use of NPS have been accepted. In this respect, it should be noted that in its 1981 report, the Working Group on the Use of Power Sources in Outer Space concluded that power sources can be used safely in outer space, provided that all necessary safety requirements are met. This is also a succinct statement of the U.S. position.
title: United Nations deliberations of the use of nuclear power sources in space: 1978-1987

publications.publicationName: New Mexico Univ., Transactions of the Fifth Symposium on Space Nuclear Power Systems
